Ant=C3=B3nio Mota <amsmota@...> writes:
> What I don't understand is =
why in a post that started with the subject 
> "Generic REST client" people=
 were so quick to turn it into a "generic 
> HTTP client". 

Because while =
the subject said "REST", it was clear in the body that he
was talking about=
 "HTTP"; it always was a generic HTTP client thread.


Not that I think the=
 two concepts should always be mixed together; we
should take care to separ=
ate them when appropriate.  But there are a lot
of people in the world look=
ing to create practical RESTful solutions of
course in HTTP.  Trying to tal=
k about REST in the absence of concrete
HTTP can quickly become really hand=
wavy and imprecise, since most lack
the shared terminology and communicativ=
e rigor to have a productive
conversation.
